meanings.definition: Of or relating to self-sufficiency or self-reliance.
meanings.sent1: She admired the autarkical lifestyle of living off the land.
meanings.sent2: The community's autarkical approach to farming ensured they rarely needed outside help.
meanings.sent3: In his autarkical quest to fix the broken bike, he ended up making it worse.
meanings.sent4: Her autarkical nature was like a shield against the chaos of the world.
meanings.sent5: The image of the lone wolf perfectly captured the essence of autarkical living.

meanings.definition: A person or country that is self-sufficient or self-reliant.
meanings.sent1: The autarkical was skilled in growing their own food and making their own clothes.
meanings.sent2: The small island nation prided itself on being autarkical in times of crisis.
meanings.sent3: The autarkical in the group always had a solution for every problem.
meanings.sent4: The old sailor was an autarkical, relying only on his knowledge of the sea.
meanings.sent5: The ant colony was an autarkical society, each member playing a vital role in the community.
